column4: Hi, can someone tell me why I get Gtk-WARNING **: Unable to locate theme engine in module_path: "pixmap", after I've installed gtk-engines-pixmap and restarted X ?
Thanks a bundle, you've been a great help :) I'll try that now.
Have a good 'un.
Sorry to keep asking you, but, I tried pressing a key, with no luck...
sorry then i wouldn't know, the only reason that xp would boot is if booting from the cd completely failed
there isn't usually a wait of 30 seconds if you boot to xp is there?
Nope, it normally skips right past the CD part. With the live CD in, it sits there spinning for a bit, then goes to xP
It also skips past it with a non-bootable CD in there
have you tried updating your bios firmware?
Uhh. *Looks baffled* I'm not that advanced... And I don't wanna go through that much trouble, as I wouldn't actually be installing ubuntu on this machine anyway ;)

well if you go into the bios menu it should tell you the number and the manufacturer hopefully. you go to your motherboard manufacturer's website and check the latest bios, and use their utilities to update it if necessary
I'd rather not try anything like that, is it's not actually my computer I'm testing the CD on. He gave me enough of a hairy eyeball when I described what the CD would (Or.. should...) do :P
loool i see
so why did you bring an armada of livecds to use?
Well, I ordered lots, because... They were free... I tried the one, and when that failed, I got reinforcements >_>
just remember that those cds are needed to help other people that wouldn't otherwise have access to foss get it
Yeah, I know. Loads of my friends are interested, but not sure about it. Was planning on passing them around
ahh ok :)
Sorry if it seems like I've been wasting your time :) I really appreciate the help, I just don't wanna risk blowing this PC to smithereens >_>
lol no not wasting anyones time
thats the purpose of this channel lol, to help
you can always ask on ##linux
